p.s: thankThank you for your last e-mail, in which you were telling me about the newspaper article Mehr Bio nicht nur am Freitag, published in November 2019 in the Kölner Stadt Anzeiger.
I've read the article and want to tell you what it is about.
The highschool KLS organized an event called KLS goes green.
It took place in one day, with over 40 projects, that students could participate in, in the school and in it'sitsarea.
It was the first time, this even had took place.
It was organized by students and teachers.
Because of an increase in interest in political and social problems, associated with the Fridays for Future movement on sides of the students, KLS goes green was founded set in place.
All of the projects had to do with climate change and sustainability.
The students had many ideas how to increase sustainability in our day-to-day lives, i.e. foodsharing, thrifting or economizing water and selling organic food and snacks in the school.
In the school's fairtrade café, students sold organic fair and vegan products.
Two poetry slammers also visited teh school and one of them conducted a project for the students in which they could learn to use their voice to convey a certain atmosphere and content.
According to Peter Clemm, who participated in organizing the event, claims to be very content about the outcome of the event and looking forward to it possibly taking place next year.
I hope I could help you understand the article.
